13.17: "The rains do not stop, except for when there is a nullification of priestly gifts and tithes, as it says, 'Aridity, and also heat, steal from the days of snow.'"

13.21: Rav Shimon the son of Pazi said,
13.22: "The rains do not stop, except because of the tellers of slander, as it says, 'The north wind births rain, and angry faces (birth) private language.'"
13.24: 'The rains do not stop, except for when there is arrogance, as it says, 'And the showers have been stopped, and the latter rains did not take place, for you had the forehead of a harlot {and refused to be ashamed}.'"
13.25: Rav Sela also said, "Rav Himnuna said,
13.26: 'Every man who is arrogant, in time will be caught up in sin, as it says (of the arrogant): 'And you had the forehead of a harlot.'"
13.28: "It is known that he (the arrogant one) is already caught up in sin, as it says, 'You had [the forehead of a harlot],' and not 'You will have.'"
13.29: Rabba the son of Rav Huna said,
13.3: Rabbi Chama the son of Chanina said,
13.30: "Every person who is arrogant may be called an evildoer, as it says, 'The arrogant man [can be called] an evildoer in his face.'"
13.31: Rav Nachman the son of Yitzchak said,
13.32: "You are allowed to hate him [the arrogant one], as it says, 'and the arrogant of face shall change.' Do not read 'shall change (Yeshuneh),' but 'shall be hated (Yisanei).'"
13.34: "The rain does not stop, except for when there is a nullification of Torah [study], as it says, 'with laziness shall the beams be injured" . Because of the laziness in Israel, that they didn't study Torah, the enemies of the Holy One, Blessed be He (euphemism for Israel), were injured, and there is such term as injury except for poverty, as it says, 'if he be poorer than his worth,' and there is no such term as beams except for the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it says, 'he who chills with water his higher dwelling.'"
13.35: Rav Yosef quoted from the following, "'And now they shall see no clear light in the heavens, but a spirit shall pass and purify them,' and there is no such term as light except for Torah, as it says, 'For a candle is the commandment, and the Torah is a light.'
13.36: "Clear in the Heavens:" it was taught at the school of Rabbi Yishmael,
13.37: Even in the time that the sky is made clear to bring dew and rain, a spirit passesand purifies them.
13.39: "The rain does not stop, except for when there is the sin of robbery, like it says, 'Because of palms, light was covered,' which means that because of the sin of palms, the light was covered. There is no such term as palms except for armed robbery/violence, as it says, 'And from the violence in their palms'. There is no light, except for rain, as it says, 'a cloud will scatter its light.
13.4: "The day of rain is as great as the day of the creation of heaven and earth, as it says, 'Heavens, drop down from above, and let the sky pour forth righteousness; let the earth open and flower salvation, and righteousness will grow along with it- I am G-d, I have created it.'
13.40: How do we fix [the problem of insufficient rain and robbery]? Increase in prayer,
13.41: As it says, 'And he commanded about her regarding a touch' and their is no touching except for prayer, as it says, 'And you, do not pray on behalf of this people, and do not come into contact with me."
13.43: "What does it mean, 'If the iron be blunt, then it is not damaged on the surface?' If you have seen a sky as blunt as iron, [shut up] from giving dew and rain, it is because of the deeds of the generation, that they secretly damage [society], as it says, 'it is not damaged on the surface.'
13.44: "How do they fix it? They should increase in mercy, as is says (in the continuation of the last verse), 'Then one should increase strength, and the direction of wisdom is profitable'. If they had acted in a proper manner originally [then they would not need mercy]."
13.46: "If you have seen a student... {continued next daf}
13.5: 'I have created them,' it did not say, but rather, 'I have created it [indicating that rain and the  whole world are a singular creation].'"
13.7: "The day of rain is so great that even salvation increases and grows on it (the day), as it says, 'Let the earth open and flower salvation.'"

38.49: Achiyah the Shilonite cursed [Israel] as a reed. He said to Israel, "ADONAI will strike down Israel as the wavering reed,"(1 Kgs, 14:15) for as the reed stands in a watery place, sprouts shoots, and has abundant roots, so even if all the winds in the world come and blow against it, it will not shift from its place, but rather it will sway to and fro with them.

56.58: And the form of a palm appeared, and took them, and they jumped and fell into the fire.
56.59: And upon them Isaiah lamented, "The burden concerning the Valley of Vision. What ails you now, that all of you have gone up to the roofs? You are full of uproar, a tumultuous city, a joyous town! Your corpses are not corpses of swords, and not the killed of battle (Isaiah 22:1)."
56.6: "[On] that very day, they strayed from following G-d."
56.60: Even the by Holy One, Blessed be He, it was said, "Kir shouting, crying at the Mount (Isaiah 22:5)."
56.61: (Mishnah:) Once Av has entered, we decrease in happiness, etc. - Rabbi Judah the son of Rabbi Samuel the son of Shilat said in the of Rav,
56.62: Just like as soon as Av has entered, we decrease in happiness, so too as soon as Adar has entered, we increase in happiness.
56.7: And it is written, "And the mixed multitude among them desired a desire, and they returned and [caused] the Children of Israel to cry also...[leading up to the story of the quail, which is described in the next line] (Numbers 11:4)"
56.8: And it is written, "[And the quail fell] until a month..." which makes gives you the twenty-second of Sivan [using addition].
56.9: And it is written, "And Miriam was quarantined for seven days (Numbers 12:15)," which gives you the twenty-ninth of Sivan, and it is written,

57.1: "Therefore, an Israelite who has a court case in a gentile court should avoid it in Av, for [then] his luck is bad, and find time in Adar, for [then] his luck is good."
57.2: "To give you a future and hope (Jeremiah 29:11)"- Rabbi Yehudah the son of Rav Shmuel the son of Shilat said in the name of Rav,
57.3: "These are palm trees and flax utensils."
57.4: "And he said, 'The smell of my son is like that of a field which G-d has blessed (Genesis 27:27)"- Rabbi Yehudah the son of Rav Shmuel the son of Shilat said in the name of Rav,
57.6: (Mishnah:) During the week that the Ninth of Av falls on, it is forbidden to have a haircut and to launder-
57.8: "They only taught [this rule] about laundering to wear, but to launder and put down [the garment, without wearing it,] is permissible. Rabbi Sheishet said,
57.9: "Even to launder and leave [the garment is forbidden].

9.0: ...R. Nachman said to R. Yitzchak, What is the meaning of the verse, And it came to pass when Samuel was old. Did Samuel become old? He lived only for fifty-two years. As it was said, If a man dies at age 52 he is said to have died at the age reached by Shmuel, the Ramati? [R. Yitzchak] said,  R. Yochanan said, Old age jumped upon him, as it is written, I regret that I made Shaul King. [Shmuel] said, Lord of the World, You have equated me with Moshe and Aharon, as it is said  Moshe and Aharon are among God’s priests, and Shmuel among those who call in God’s name. Just as with Moshe and Aharon, their handiwork was not canceled in their time, so too let my handiwork not be canceled in my lifetime. God said, How shall I act? Should Shaul die? Shmuel will not allow it. Should Shmuel die young? People will cast aspersions on him. Should neither Shmuel nor Shaul die? The time has come for David to reign and one kingship may not encroach on another even by a hair's breadth. God said: I will cause old age to jump on [Shmuel].
